bababel.rabbitmq package¶

Submodules¶

bababel.rabbitmq.rabbitmq_client module¶

class bababel.rabbitmq.rabbitmq_client.RabbitMQClient[source]¶

Bases: IClient

Class responsible for communication with RabbitQ broker.

connect(host: str, port: int, username: str, password: str) → RabbitMQConnection[source]¶

Establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ broker.

Parameters:

  • host (str) – The RabbitMQ server hostname or IP address.

  • port (int) – The port number for the RabbitMQ service.

  • username (str) – The username for authentication.

  • password (str) – The password for authentication.

Returns:

An instance of RabbitMQConnection with the established connection.

Return type:

RabbitMQConnection

bababel.rabbitmq.rabbitmq_connection module¶

class bababel.rabbitmq.rabbitmq_connection.RabbitMQConnection(parameters: ConnectionParameters)[source]¶

Bases: IConnection

RabbitMQConnection is a wrapper around pika’s BlockingConnection to manage RabbitMQ communication.

This class simplifies queue declaration and message consumption.

conn¶

The established RabbitMQ connection.

Type:

BlockingConnection

channel¶

The communication channel for RabbitMQ operations.

Type:

BlockingChannel

basic_consume(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Consumes messages from a queue.

Parameters:

  • *args – Positional arguments for pika.BlockingChannel.basic_consume.

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments for pika.BlockingChannel.basic_consume.

queue_declare(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Declares a queue in RabbitMQ.

Parameters:

  • *args – Positional arguments for pika.BlockingChannel.queue_declare.

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments for pika.BlockingChannel.queue_declare.

start_consuming()[source]¶

Starts consuming messages from the queue. This method enters an infinite loop, listening for messages.
